decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of removal spells and counters, while also generating card advantage through card draw and recursion. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful planeswalkers, efficient removal spells, and versatile creatures to outvalue opponents and maintain board control. Additionally, the inclusion of the companion card Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for additional card advantage and synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and grind out wins by outvaluing them in the long game.

The deck focuses on using Gyruda, Doom of Depths as a companion to support a combo strategy. It utilizes cards like Lotus Petal, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Chrome Mox to quickly ramp up mana and plenty of copy creatures like Phantasmal Image, Spark Double, and Dack's Duplicate to create a powerful board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to control the game and protect the combo. Overall, the deck aims to assemble a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential.

The deck focuses on aggressively disrupting opponent's strategy while deploying efficient threats to quickly close out the game. By utilizing disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker along with land destruction tools like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, the deck aims to slow down opponents' game plan. At the same time, the deck utilizes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance its creatures and push for damage. With a mix of disruptive elements and aggressive threats, the deck aims to control the game and come out on top in the early stages.

The key concept of this Hogaak combo deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Careful Study, Once Upon a Time, and Stitcher's Supplier, and then use Altar of Dementia to sacrifice creatures to bring out Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and trigger Vengevine. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast graveyard recursion, creature recursion, and token generation from Bridge from Below to create an unstoppable board presence and win the game through efficient combos and overwhelming aggression.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and tempo while applying pressure through efficient threats such as Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Hooting Mandrills. The deck uses disruptive elements like Wasteland, Daze, Stifle, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing efficient removal and countermagic such as Lightning Bolt, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Spell Snare to maintain board control and protect its own threats. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing Gyruda, Doom of Depths as a powerful combo piece to generate advantage by repeatedly milling both players' libraries. It employs various ways to ramp into Gyruda quickly, such as Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal, while also including clones like Phantasmal Image and Spark Double to copy Gyruda's ability. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer while also maintaining a solid mana base with lands like City of Traitors and Cavern of Souls.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a fast and aggressive board presence using Human creatures in combination with disruptive spells like Meddling Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. With a high density of Humans in the deck, cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant can quickly grow out of control, overwhelming the opponent. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient mana usage and instant speed creature deployment. Additionally, the deck includes key utility creatures like Deputy of Detention and Imperial Recruiter to deal with problematic threats and provide card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and applying pressure to the opponent through a mix of efficient and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and True-Name Nemesis, the deck aims to control the early game with countermagic and removal, while also dealing significant damage with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency and the ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland. Overall, the deck's strategy is to be aggressive and disruptive, aiming to end the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing the companion mechanic with Yorion, Sky Nomad to provide additional value and flexibility. It combines elements of aggro and control with a focus on tempo and disruption. The deck includes a mix of versatile and powerful cards such as Oko, Thief of Crowns, Teferi, Time Raveler, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to control the board and disrupt opponents while applying pressure with creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl, Baleful Strix, and Meddling Mage. The mana base is built to support a variety of colors and provide consistency.

This deck focuses on assembling the Aluren combo, which allows you to cast creatures for free and generate a powerful board presence. The deck includes various value creatures, card draw spells, and disruptive cards to control the game until you can assemble the combo. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with efficient creatures and card advantage while disrupting their game plan. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion adds an extra level of consistency and value to the deck. Ultimately, the key concept of this deck is to combo off with Aluren and win the game through sheer synergy and card advantage.

The main strategy of this Aggro Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by slowing them down with taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and mana denial with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. The deck also aims to control the board with creatures like Flickerwisp and Mother of Runes, while applying pressure with cards like Sanctum Prelate and Stoneforge Mystic. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in longer games. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of disruption and efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with dredge cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Golgari Thug, using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough. The deck aims to then utilize cards like Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy to create powerful board states and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Narcomoeba, the deck can quickly assemble combos and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence while utilizing the graveyard as a resource.

The main strategy of this Esper Vial deck is to control the board using disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Recruiter of the Guard, while also utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt your opponent's plays. Aether Vial allows you to cheat creatures into play and generate value with cards like Soulherder. Additionally, cards like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will help you deal with threats efficiently. The deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt your opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The deck revolves around using Gyruda, Doom of Depths as a companion to create a powerful combo with creatures that have strong enters-the-battlefield effects. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, the deck aims to quickly ramp into playing multiple copies of Gyruda or other powerful creatures like Dragonlord Kolaghan and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes cards like Phantasmal Image and Spark Double to copy key creatures and maximize their effectiveness, creating a potent and synergistic combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Gravecrawler, Vengevine, and Bloodghast, while utilizing cards like Careful Study, Cabal Therapy, and Stitcher's Supplier to discard cards and trigger Bridge from Below. Once the graveyard is full, players can bring out Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and use Altar of Dementia to mill opponents out or attack for lethal damage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and powerful graveyard-based combo strategy, utilizing strong synergy between its cards to create a powerful board state.

The main concept of this Legacy Combo Reanimator deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria using cards like Entomb, Faithless Looting, and Unmask. The deck then aims to bring back these creatures onto the battlefield using Animate Dead, Exhume, and Reanimate to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy and Chancellor of the Annex to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.
